abstract.p: Russia's property ministry is expected to set terms next week for sale of 85 percent stake in Onako, state-controlled oil company; ministry also says it plans to sell 4.5 percent stake in Lukoil Holding, Russia's biggest oil company, on New York Stock Exchange in August; sales are expected to raise at least $714 million for government (S)

block.p: Russia's property ministry is expected to set the terms next week for the sale of an 85 percent stake in Onako, a state-controlled oil company. Its output is equal to about 10 percent of Russia's biggest oil company, Lukoil Holding, according to the United Financial Group, a brokerage firm in Moscow. The ministry also said it planned to sell a 4.5 percent stake in Lukoil on the New York Stock Exchange in August. The sales are expected to raise at least $714 million for the government.
